intro: Leucopogon concinnus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in woodland or heathland environments. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and the flowers are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Leucopogon concinnus is often found in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
